thread.title: If he had his way, Iceland's President would ban pineapple pizza
thread.title_full: If he had his way, Iceland's President would ban pineapple pizza

title: If he had his way, Iceland's President would ban pineapple pizza
text:
If he had his way, Iceland's President would ban pineapple pizza By Delaney Strunk, CNN Updated 1550 GMT (2350 HKT) February 21, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. If President JÃ³hannesson had it his way this pizza would be illegal. Story highlights Though heavily debated, pineapple remains one of the most popular pizza toppings Despite its name, Hawaiian pizza was actually invented in Canada (CNN) The food world is riddled with heated debates, and one of the most polarizing fights centers around pineapple on pizza. This week Iceland's President GuÃ°ni Th. JÃ³hannesson let us know where he stands. After taking questions from students at a high school in North Iceland, one bold pupil asked Johannesson what he thought about pineapple as a pizza topping. The president held nothing back expressing his disdain for the pairing. He also said if he had the power to pass laws, he'd ban it across the land, the local news site Visir reported . As expected, Twitter lit up: Read More â€” lalammar (@Layla_AlAmmar) February 21, 2017 Though most of Twitter rallied around the ban, there were a few outspoken opponents who stood up for the topping. Iceland's President wants to ban pineapple on pizza?? oh my why is there such hatred towards that, pineapple on pizza doesn't deserve itðŸ˜‚ â€” wassy fassyðŸ¦‰ (@fassywassy) February 21, 2017 Of course, DiGiorno Pizza wasn't about to sit this one out. No ban here ðŸ™ƒ pic.twitter.com/vmSJw5F1ew â€” DiGiorno Pizza (@DiGiornoPizza) February 21, 2017 While this may not be the most controversial ban floating around politics, it wouldn't be surprising if a "Hawaiian pizza lovers" rally popped up in the near future.
